Posted By: IntrnetHte (8/27/2011 2:52:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
With this guy and [Melira](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=194274) leading the resistance, and [Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=214378) backing them as support, there is no way that Wizards isn't coming back to this plane in the future.  
  
If you're running monowhite equipment, this guy makes splashing red definitely worth it. With [Goblin Gaveleer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Gaveleer), [Galavonic Blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Galavonic Blast) and [Hellkite Igniter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellkite Igniter) already in the block, if you weren't already doing this, you have little excuse not to now.  
  
@IntrnetHte  
  
I guess "backing" is a strong word choice. He's definitely harboring them. I think I read somewhere that he's the least "devout" of the praetors. Maybe he'll defect. I just know that flavor-wise, he doesn't seem very Phyrexian (i'm talking about the card) and red is the least corrupted color as far as infect goes.
posts.html:
With this guy and Melira leading the resistance, and Urabrask backing them as support, there is no way that Wizards isn't coming back to this plane in the future.

If you're running monowhite equipment, this guy makes splashing red definitely worth it. With Goblin Gaveleer, Galavonic Blast and Hellkite Igniter already in the block, if you weren't already doing this, you have little excuse not to now.

@IntrnetHte

I guess "backing" is a strong word choice. He's definitely harboring them. I think I read somewhere that he's the least "devout" of the praetors. Maybe he'll defect. I just know that flavor-wise, he doesn't seem very Phyrexian (i'm talking about the card) and red is the least corrupted color as far as infect goes.

Posted By: SarpNasty (8/29/2011 6:52:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If you hadn't realized, this guy is probably THE BEST Red White general there is. I've played a few others. [Brion Stoutarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brion Stoutarm) is darn fun (especially in a dedicated Giant theme deck), but it is incredible how ridiculous this guy can be.  
  
[White Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=White Sun's Zenith) and [Martial Coup](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Martial Coup) are some of this guy's best friends. Play the Zenith at the end step of the turn right before yours, and swing in with 5/2 cats. That doesn't count any other pumps you might get with... [Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem), or (my favorite) [Marshal's Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marshal's Anthem)... BUT. The absolute best move you can make.  
  
[Elemental Mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elemental Mastery).  
  
Drop [Elemental Mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elemental Mastery) on Kadeen, and you've got 8 4/1 Elementals with Haste, and you don't have to worry about losing creatures. Or maybe the game hasn't treated you so well yet. And you are on the back foot. Holding Kadeen back, and tapping to make 8 4/1 blockers sounds like a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
If you hadn't realized, this guy is probably THE BEST Red White general there is. I've played a few others. Brion Stoutarm is darn fun (especially in a dedicated Giant theme deck), but it is incredible how ridiculous this guy can be.

White Sun's Zenith and Martial Coup are some of this guy's best friends. Play the Zenith at the end step of the turn right before yours, and swing in with 5/2 cats. That doesn't count any other pumps you might get with... Glorious Anthem, or (my favorite) Marshal's Anthem... BUT. The absolute best move you can make.

Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Names\_Suck: How did it sound like Mirrodin Pure was designed as a set? MaRo specifically said New Phyrexia was going to be the first set in the block, and *then* they decided to push it back to last. That to me says Mirrodin Pure was never going to happen, and was all made as a gimmick.  
  
I really hope we find out what is up with this guy unlike with [Ob Nixilix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ob Nixilix). At least without having to read the books. I don't know if I can bring myself to do that. @Atali: I know they'll slap Legend on a creature as a mechanics issue, but as a Vorthos sometimes the creatures are just cool enough that I want to know more about them, the aforementioned Ob Nixilis, Jor Kadeen, and [Wrexial, the Risen Deep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrexial, the Risen Deep) being my prime examples.
posts.html:
@Names_Suck: How did it sound like Mirrodin Pure was designed as a set? MaRo specifically said New Phyrexia was going to be the first set in the block, and then they decided to push it back to last. That to me says Mirrodin Pure was never going to happen, and was all made as a gimmick.

I really hope we find out what is up with this guy unlike with Ob Nixilix. At least without having to read the books. I don't know if I can bring myself to do that. @Atali: I know they'll slap Legend on a creature as a mechanics issue, but as a Vorthos sometimes the creatures are just cool enough that I want to know more about them, the aforementioned Ob Nixilis, Jor Kadeen, and Wrexial, the Risen Deep being my prime examples.

Posted By: rinoh20 (6/13/2011 12:42:15 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
So here's the thing.. I bought a pack of New Phyrexia at Target the other day and opened them at the in-store Pizza Hut while I was waiting on a pizza. I pulled this guy and thought oh he's pretty cool. I hear someone say "Hey bro, Pies ready" and look up. There's another guy at the register, a customer and he points at me and says he's talking to you, not me. I look back down at my cards, look back up at the guy and realize, Jor gets his pizza from the same Pizza Hut I do! lol. They looked so exactly the same that I decided to show him the card and even he couldn't believe it! My point is, I love good art on these cards as much as the next guy but how much longer will it be before we start seeing actual photographs of ppl and animals who live in our world on them?? When great becomes too good, it transforms into bad. I'm not saying it has, yet.. But remember that and let's keep an old art revival in mind before our beloved Magic becomes too "new". I miss the old art sometimes..  
  
  
On a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
So here's the thing.. I bought a pack of New Phyrexia at Target the other day and opened them at the in-store Pizza Hut while I was waiting on a pizza. I pulled this guy and thought oh he's pretty cool. I hear someone say "Hey bro, Pies ready" and look up. There's another guy at the register, a customer and he points at me and says he's talking to you, not me. I look back down at my cards, look back up at the guy and realize, Jor gets his pizza from the same Pizza Hut I do! lol. They looked so exactly the same that I decided to show him the card and even he couldn't believe it! My point is, I love good art on these cards as much as the next guy but how much longer will it be before we start seeing actual photographs of ppl and animals who live in our world on them?? When great becomes too good, it transforms into bad. I'm not saying it has, yet.. But remember that and let's keep an old art revival in mind before our beloved Magic becomes too "new". I miss the old art sometimes..
